metadata.title: CVE-2024-1551 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Set-Cookie response headers were being incorrectly honored in multipartHTTP responses. If an attacker could control the Content-Type responseheader, as well as control part of the response body, they could injectSet-Cookie response headers that would have been honored by the browser.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, andThunderbird < 115.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-1551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
